Sentencas: The bulk structure, surface characteristics, catalytic properties, button cell performance, and stability of perovskite-type oxides with the formula Sr1-xCexCo0.2Fe0.8O3-delta (x = 0.10, 0.15, and 0.20) were investigated as potential anode electro-catalysts for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Effect of Ce Doping on the Performance and Stability of Strontium Cobalt Ferrite Perovskites as SOFC Anode Catalysts

Sentencas: In situ X-ray diffraction results indicated that the structural stability of the cerium-doped perovskites was enhanced with increasing cerium concentration.
Titulo: Effect of Ce Doping on the Performance and Stability of Strontium Cobalt Ferrite Perovskites as SOFC Anode Catalysts

Sentencas: The catalysts with lower cerium concentration transformed from the initial cubic structure to a lower symmetry structure at high temperatures in a reducing environment.
Titulo: Effect of Ce Doping on the Performance and Stability of Strontium Cobalt Ferrite Perovskites as SOFC Anode Catalysts

Sentencas: All the catalysts, however, were restored to the original cubic structure after re-oxidation.
Titulo: Effect of Ce Doping on the Performance and Stability of Strontium Cobalt Ferrite Perovskites as SOFC Anode Catalysts

Sentencas: Electronic conductivity tests showed that the cerium-doped samples break down at higher temperatures, but display potential in terms of structural integrity and high conductivity at temperatures lower than 600 A degrees C.
Titulo: Effect of Ce Doping on the Performance and Stability of Strontium Cobalt Ferrite Perovskites as SOFC Anode Catalysts

Sentencas: The new materials showed better performance than Ni-YSZ in catalytic methane oxidation tests.
Titulo: Effect of Ce Doping on the Performance and Stability of Strontium Cobalt Ferrite Perovskites as SOFC Anode Catalysts

Sentencas: The sulfur tolerance is significantly enhanced with the cerium-doped perovskites, showing no deactivation for up to 10 h of operation under 50 ppm H2S. X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy analysis on the poisoned samples suggests that the sulfur may exist on the surface primarily as strontium sulfate.
Titulo: Effect of Ce Doping on the Performance and Stability of Strontium Cobalt Ferrite Perovskites as SOFC Anode Catalysts

Sentencas: The sample with a cerium loading of 15 % (x = 0.15) showed a particularly high sulfur tolerance during chronoamperometry tests and its button cell performance matched well with that of Ni-YSZ anode.
Titulo: Effect of Ce Doping on the Performance and Stability of Strontium Cobalt Ferrite Perovskites as SOFC Anode Catalysts

Sentencas: Sr1-xCexCo0.2Fe0.8O3-delta (x = 0.10, 0.15, and 0.20) samples may have potential for low or intermediate temperature SOFC operation in which sulfur-containing hydrocarbon fuels are used, although they would not be stable at higher temperatures.
Titulo: Effect of Ce Doping on the Performance and Stability of Strontium Cobalt Ferrite Perovskites as SOFC Anode Catalysts
